New Records: This match registers as the shortest match of the tournament (59 overs).
Pathum Nissanka has moved past a thousand ODI runs this year - the second to do so after India's Shubman Gill.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets with 146 balls remaining.
Lahiru Kumara was named player of the match for his 3 for 35, accounting for the big wickets of Jos Buttler, Liam Livingstone, and Ben Stokes.
Sadeera Samarawickrama scored a fifty from 44 deliveries, providing stability after early wickets.
Pathum Nissanka scored a half-century from 54 deliveries and has passed fifty in each of his last four innings.
David Willey took two early wickets for England, removing Kusal Perera and Kusal Mendis.
England were all out for 156, the lowest ODI total at the Chinnaswamy stadium.
Angelo Mathews took the wicket of Dawid Malan with his third ball after returning to the team.
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler decided England would bat first after winning the toss.
Sri Lanka skipper Kusal Mendis welcomed Angelo Mathews back into the XI.
Angelo Mathews was drafted in place of the injured Matheesha Pathirana.
Post-Match Reflections: Angelo Mathews praised the team's all-round performance and emphasized the importance of attitude.
Jos Buttler expressed disappointment and acknowledged the tough situation for England.
England head coach Matthew Mott was disappointed and mentioned the need to salvage something in the next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mark Wood bowled at 151 kph but struggled with his line and length.
Jonny Bairstow survived an early LBW appeal due to Sri Lanka not reviewing the decision.
